property.name: watchdog.restarts.max
property.description: The watchdog launches a sub process and restarts if it exits unexpectedly or with failure. This value is the maximum number of times per minute the watchdog can attempt to restart the subprocess.

property.name: flume.config.heartbeat.period
property.description: This is the period in ms between heartbeats.

property.name: flume.node.status.port
property.description: The port for a Flume node's HTTP status server.

property.name: flume.node.heartbeat.backoff.ceiling
property.description: This is the maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) a node will wait after backing off between attempts to heartbeat with the master.

property.name: flume.node.http.autofindport
property.description: If true, node will look for a free port starting at flume.node.status.port to start HTTP server on.

property.name: flume.agent.logdir
property.description: This is the directory that write-ahead logging data or disk-failover data is collected from applications gets written to. The agent watches this directory.

property.name: flume.agent.logdir.maxage
property.description: number of milliseconds before a local log file is considered closed and ready to forward.

property.name: flume.agent.logdir.retransmit
property.description: The time (in milliseconds) before a sent event is assumed lost and needs to be retried in end-to-end reliability mode again. This should be at least 2x the flume.collector.roll.millis.

property.name: flume.agent.failover.backoff.initial
property.description: This is the number of milliseconds to backoff when initially trying to reopen a previously failed primary sink. If the backoff time has not elapsed, the secondary sink is used.

property.name: flume.agent.failover.backoff.max
property.description: This is the maximum length of time in milliseconds that a failover of the primary is allowed back off until a attempt to re-open the primary is attempted.

property.name: flume.collector.event.host
property.description: This is the host name of the default collector.

property.name: flume.collector.port
property.description: This default tcp port that a Flume collector node listens on to receive events.

property.name: flume.collector.dfs.dir
property.description: This is a dfs directory that is the the final resting place for logs to be stored in. This defaults to a local dir in /tmp but can be hadoop URI path that such as hdfs://namenode/path/

property.name: flume.collector.dfs.compress.codec
property.description: Writes formated data compressed in specified codec to dfs. Value is None, GZipCodec, DefaultCodec (deflate), BZip2Codec, or any other Codec hadoop is aware of

property.name: flume.collector.roll.millis
property.description: The time (in milliseconds) between when hdfs files are closed and a new file is opened (rolled).

property.name: flume.collector.output.format
property.description: The output format for the data written by a Flume collector node. There are several formats available: syslog - outputs events in a syslog-like format log4j - outputs events in a pattern similar to Hadoop's log4j pattern raw - Event body only. This is most similar to copying a file but does not preserve any uniqifying metadata like host/timestamp/nanos. avro - Avro Native file format. Default currently is uncompressed. avrojson - this outputs data as json encoded by avro avrodata - this outputs data as a avro binary encoded data debug - used only for debugging

property.name: flume.master.servers
property.description: A comma-separated list of hostnames, one for each machine in the Flume Master.

property.name: flume.master.store
property.description: How the Flume Master stores node configurations. Must be either 'zookeeper' or 'memory'.

property.name: flume.master.serverid
property.description: The unique identifier for a machine in a Flume Master ensemble. Must be different on every master instance.

property.name: flume.master.http.port
property.description: The port on which a Flume Master machine starts its HTTP server.

property.name: flume.master.heartbeat.missed.max
property.description: This is the maximum amount of heartbeats a node can miss before it is considered lost.

property.name: flume.master.savefile
property.description: Node configurations can be saved to this file, and reloaded at startup.

property.name: flume.master.savefile.autoload
property.description: If true, node configurations will be loaded at startup from flume.config.savefile.

property.name: flume.master.gossip.period
property.description: The time (in milliseconds) that a Flume Master server waits between rounds of gossip.

property.name: flume.master.heartbeat.rpc
property.description: This specifies the RPC(THRIFT/AVRO) framework to be used between nodes and the master and the shell and the master. The default is THRIFT.

property.name: flume.event.rpc
property.description: This specifies the default RPC(THRIFT/AVRO) framework to be used for node-to-node event transmission when using rpcSink / rpcSource and autoCollectorSource / agent*Sink / agent*Chain / auto*Chains. The default is THRIFT.

property.name: flume.report.server.rpc.type
property.description: This specifies the RPC(THRIFT/AVRO) framework to be used for the ReportServer. The default is THRIFT.

property.name: flume.master.zk.logdir
property.description: The base directory in which the ZBCS stores data.
